feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle uses the same key for QR login and auto-login
entry.content:
A unique key should be generated for a user's QR login key and their auto-login key, so the same key cannot be used interchangeably between the two.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38277
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=459502
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/0caedaab7cd5a46331d56654ce9301b0a5a04c56
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/1aea4a15281d81f2414a95aa485b8a6551708f57
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/ad46a97f5355f0451d52e9f1a0f528d9a6f12e06
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/d05795db8eece2943241a29a5443fb4685ba6070
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r82w-3phg-qvr4

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle CSRF risks due to misuse of confirm_sesskey
entry.content:
Incorrect CSRF token checks resulted in multiple CSRF risks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38276
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=459501

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle HTTP authorization header is preserved between "emulated redirects"
entry.content:
The cURL wrapper in Moodle retained the original request headers when following redirects, so HTTP authorization header information could be unintentionally sent in requests to redirect URLs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38275
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=459500
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/0df3c5837a592e6663c4d531ff6a1f776bc2f785
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/3e38c84315a7991ce5ef5f241f5e873b5ca24f01
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/836b2c23a210317d130017d77bb64e3b510869a9
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/f7988538b2208c55f2c40ce4f0815901dc88049b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p2cj-86v4-7782

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr arbitrary file upload vulnerability
entry.content:
An arbitrary file upload vulnerability in the Upload Template function of Dolibarr ERP CRM up to v19.0.1 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via uploading a crafted .SQL file.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-37821
  • https://github.com/alexbsec/CVEs/blob/master/2024/CVE-2024-37821.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p7r8-7w87-8g46

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle stored XSS via calendar's event title when deleting the event
entry.content:
Insufficient escaping of calendar event titles resulted in a stored XSS risk in the event deletion prompt.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38274
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=459499
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p5cg-6rfr-6mx8

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle BigBlueButton web service leaks meeting joining information
entry.content:
Insufficient capability checks meant it was possible for users to gain access to BigBlueButton join URLs they did not have permission to access.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38273
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=459498
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/500cec575731fd8575569dcb5811535751dddae1
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/647b9dc06409211018c9f28581504d096ce9e3a8
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/6c0645ca29b195b5caaffc27d80f2ff715c33a48
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/a10506b8d70609478fef156d489e0c7d727b6098
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x29x-qwvx-fxr2
